experiment.description: Meeting classification using GitHub Copilot's native LLM capabilities

classifier.name: GitHub Copilot
classifier.note: GitHub Copilot uses advanced GPT-4 models with extended context windows and enhanced reasoning capabilities

metadata.classification_method: AI-powered semantic analysis with contextual reasoning

classification.reasoning: This is an asynchronous task time block for updating the Copilot Agility BPR (Business Planning Review) documentation. The [Async Task] label, large optional attendee list (29 people), and focus on documentation updates indicate this is a scheduled work time rather than a synchronous meeting. The location 'Your Desk' and service account organizer confirm it's a process/documentation update task.
key_indicators: [Async Task] in title indicates non-synchronous work
Focus on updating documentation (BPR doc)
Service account organizer (Copilot Software Factory)
Location is 'Your Desk' not meeting room
Large optional attendee list suggests awareness/transparency rather than active participation
classification.business_value: Medium - ensures agility documentation stays current

meetings.subject: Virtual Interview for Senior Applied Scientist(LLM) (1864549)

classification.reasoning: This is clearly a job interview for a Senior Applied Scientist position focused on LLM (Large Language Models). The meeting is organized by Microsoft Recruit recruiting system, includes candidate name (Bei Wang), job requisition number (1864549), and involves the hiring manager (Chin-Yew Lin) plus HR representatives. The virtual format via Teams is standard for remote candidate interviews.
key_indicators: Title explicitly states 'Virtual Interview'
Organized by Microsoft Recruit system
Includes job requisition number (1864549)
Position clearly specified: Senior Applied Scientist(LLM)
Candidate name mentioned in body: Bei Wang
HR representatives included as optional attendees
Hiring manager accepted (Chin-Yew Lin)
classification.business_value: Critical - talent acquisition for key technical role

classification.reasoning: This is a recurring synchronization meeting (STCA = Singapore/Taiwan/China/Australia time zone friendly) for the Meeting Prep product team. The meeting focuses on discussing latest updates, evaluation needs, and leveraging the M-Arena tool. The body preview mentions 'Golden Prompt work' and extending discussion time, indicating ongoing project coordination. The cross-regional team (10 attendees) suggests this is a core team sync for a specific initiative.
key_indicators: 'Sync' in title indicates status/coordination meeting
Meeting Prep is the product being discussed
Multiple work streams mentioned: Golden Prompt work, evaluations, M-Arena tool
Extended meeting time (1h 25m) for in-depth discussion
Core team members from Meeting Prep initiative
STCA timezone optimization indicates distributed team coordination
Recent meeting note (09/26) shows this is recurring with evolving agenda
classification.business_value: High - coordinates key product development work

meetings.subject: Discuss Meeting Prep Bizchat Eval and Scorecard

classification.reasoning: This is a focused technical discussion to define evaluation criteria and scorecards for the Meeting Prep feature in BizChat. The meeting was set up following a previous T+P (Test + Production) and Hive team meeting where evaluation methodology was identified as a need. The small, focused group (4 people - Caroline Mao, Amir Kantor, Haidong Zhang, Chin-Yew Lin) indicates a working session to establish metrics and evaluation framework.
key_indicators: Focus on defining evaluation methodology and scorecard
Follow-up from previous T+P/Hive strategic meeting
Small expert group (4 technical leads)
Short duration (25 min) suggests focused discussion
Technical topic: evaluation framework for AI feature
Cross-team collaboration (T+P helping with Hive's eval needs)
All attendees accepted - indicates priority/importance
classification.business_value: High - establishes quality metrics for product feature

meetings.subject: meeting prep evals sync and discussion

classification.reasoning: This is a synchronization meeting focused on Meeting Prep evaluation work. The lowercase title and Teams meeting format suggest an informal but regular sync. The 4-person team (Haidong Zhang, Kening Ren, Weiwei Cui, Chin-Yew Lin) appears to be a working group discussing evaluation progress and methodology. This follows the earlier meeting about evaluation scorecards, suggesting this is the execution/sync meeting for that work.
key_indicators: 'sync and discussion' indicates status update format
Focus on evaluations ('evals') for Meeting Prep
Small working group (4 people)
Organized by technical lead (Haidong Zhang)
1-hour duration for detailed discussion
Follows earlier scorecard planning meeting (same day)
All attendees accepted except organizer (auto-accept)
classification.relationship_to_other_meetings: Execution follow-up to 14:05 scorecard planning meeting

meetings.subject: Copilot Insight Engine Office Hour (Asia & EU)

classification.reasoning: This is a recurring office hours session for the Copilot Insight Engine (CIE) platform, specifically scheduled for Asia & EU time zones. The invitation explicitly states it's 'an open session where we'll address your questions' and attendees can 'bring your questions or just listen in'. The service distribution lists (BizChat, MSAI Data Analytics) and regional team members indicate this is a support/education session for users of the CIE platform.
key_indicators: Explicitly labeled 'Office Hour' in title
Body text confirms Q&A format: 'address your questions'
Optional attendance: 'just listen in'
Regional optimization: 'Asia & EU' timezone
Service distribution lists as attendees (BizChat, MSAI Data Analytics)
Platform support focus: Copilot Insight Engine
Short 30-minute duration typical of office hours
classification.business_value: Medium - provides user support and platform education
classification.recurring_pattern: Weekly office hours for different regions

meetings.subject: SynthetIQ: Turning Data Scarcity into Competitive Velocity

classification.reasoning: This is a webinar-style presentation about SynthetIQ technology (synthetic data generation) with three identified speakers (Aparana Gupta, Anurup Dey, Suyash Dwivedi). The formal title, speaker list, broadcast distribution list (EventsOnly_AIML-CC), and optional organizer group (Alex Blanton + 4 co-organizers) indicate this is a large-scale educational event about AI/ML technology. The topic 'Turning Data Scarcity into Competitive Velocity' suggests a strategic technology showcase.
key_indicators: Formal presentation title with strategic messaging
Three named speakers listed in body
Multiple co-organizers (Jorge Garcia Ximenez, Alex Blanton, Alexandra Savelieva, Jason Virtue, Mark Tabladillo)
Broadcast distribution list: EventsOnly_AIML-CC
1-hour duration typical of webinar format
Technology showcase: SynthetIQ (synthetic data)
Late evening time (11pm Beijing) suggests PST audience primary
classification.business_value: Medium - educates team on synthetic data capabilities

classification.reasoning: This is a recurring weekly meeting to review experimental flights (A/B tests) running in BizChat and make ship decisions based on customer impact data. The agenda explicitly states 'Review each flight with a doc ready for review at https://aka.ms/BizChatFlights' and the goal is to 'Learn about customer impact of experiments to inform ship decisions'. This is a data-driven product review meeting where the team evaluates experiment results to decide which features to ship.
key_indicators: 'Weekly Flight Review' indicates recurring metrics review
Goal: 'Learn about customer impact of experiments to inform ship decisions'
Structured agenda with review documentation (aka.ms/BizChatFlights)
Team distribution list: MSAI USR Gaurav Directs
Service DL as optional: BizChat platform team
Decision-making focus: ship/no-ship based on data
Regular cadence: weekly review meeting
classification.business_value: High - drives product shipping decisions based on customer data
classification.review_focus: A/B test experiments and customer impact metrics
